member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper
member.summary: The InteractionHelper provides controls with support for all of the common interactions like mouse movement, mouse clicks, key presses, etc., and also incorporates proper event semantics when the control is disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInMilliseconds
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper._updateVisualState
member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.#ctor(System.Windows.Controls.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualStateBase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.OnLoaded(System.Object,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handle the control's Loaded event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.OnIsEnabledChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handle changes to the control's IsEnabled property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.OnApplyTemplateBase
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control when its template is changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.Control
member.summary: Gets the control the InteractionHelper is targeting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.IsFocused
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control has focus.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mouse is over the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.IsPressed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mouse button is pressed down over the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.LastClickTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the last time the control was clicked.
member.remarks: The value is stored as Utc time because it is slightly more performant than converting to local time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.LastClickPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse position of the last click.
member.remarks: The value is relative to the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.InteractionHelper.ClickCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times the control was clicked.

member.summary: Gets the original string value that failed to parse.

member.summary: Gets the exception that was raised during the initial parsing attempt.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the event is handled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.Spinner
member.summary: Base class for controls that represents controls that can spin.
member.remarks: Spinner abstract class defines and implements common and focused visual state groups. Spinner abstract class defines and implements Spin event and OnSpin method.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Spinner class.

member.summary: Raises the OnSpin event when spinning is initiated by the end-user.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.Spinner.Spin
member.summary: Occurs when spinning is initiated by the end-user.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid double value '{0}': valid value is of double type and within decimal range..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.Properties.Resources.NumericUpDown_OnDecimalPlacesPropertyChanged_InvalidValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid DecimalPlaces value '{0}': valid value is of int type and within 0 and 15 inclusive..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.Properties.Resources.RoutedPropertyChangingEventArgs_CancelSet_InvalidOperation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The RoutedPropertyChangingEvent cannot be canceled!.

member.summary: Base class for all controls that provide value manipulation with a Spinner and a text box.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.UpDownBase
member.summary: Base class for all controls that provide value manipulation with a Spinner and a text box.
member.remarks: This non generic base class is used to specify default template, and simulate covariance among sub classes of UpDownBase<T>.

member.summary: Private field to hold previous value of TextBox.Text.

member.summary: Event handler for Text template part's LostFocus event. We use this event to compare current TextBox.Text with cached previous value to decide whether user has typed in a new value.

member.summary: Event handler for Text template part's GotFocus event. This event handler selects the whole text on GotFocus when nothing is selected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.EnsureValidDoubleValue(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Ensure the new value of a dependency property change is a valid double value, or revert the change and throw an exception.
member.remarks: EnsureValidDoubleValue(DependencyObject d, DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs e) is simply a wrapper for EnsureValidDoubleValue(DependencyObject d, DependencyProperty property, object oldValue, object newValue).
member.param: The DependencyObject whose DependencyProperty is changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.EnsureValidDoubleValue(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyProperty,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Ensure the new value of a dependency property change is a valid double value, or revert the change and throw an exception.
member.param: The DependencyObject whose DependencyProperty is changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.EnsureValidIncrementValue(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Ensure the new value of Increment dependency property change is valid, or revert the change and throw an exception.
member.param: The DependencyObject whose DependencyProperty is changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.EnsureValidDecimalPlacesValue(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Ensure the new value of DecimalPlaces dependency property change is valid, or revert the change and throw an exception.
member.param: The DependencyObject whose DecimalPlaces DependencyProperty is changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the Minimum possible Value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the Maximum possible Value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.Increment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value added or subtracted from the value property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.NumericUpDown.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the NumericUpDown.
member.remarks:
The default value is zero.
DecimalPlaces decides output format of Value property. It is implemented via formatString field and FormatValue override.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.VisualStates.GoToState(System.Windows.Controls.Control,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Use VisualStateManager to change the visual state of the control.
member.param: Control whose visual state is being changed.
A value indicating whether to use transitions when updating the visual state, or to snap directly to the new visual state.
Ordered list of state names and fallback states to transition into. Only the first state to be found will be used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.VisualStates.GetImplementationRoot(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the implementation root of the Control.
member.remarks: Implements Silverlight's corresponding internal property on Control.
member.returns: Returns the implementation root or null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.VisualStates.TryGetVisualStateGroup(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.String)
member.summary: This method tries to get the named VisualStateGroup for the dependency object. The provided object's ImplementationRoot will be looked up in this call.
member.returns: Returns null or the VisualStateGroup object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.IUpdateVisualState
member.summary: The IUpdateVisualState interface is used to provide the InteractionHelper with access to the type's UpdateVisualState method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.IUpdateVisualState.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
